message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with superpixel decomposition, which is a common task in computer vision and image processing. The proposed method focuses on enforcing color homogeneity, adherence to image contours, and shape regularity of the decomposition. These aspects are all related to computer vision and graphics, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) and cs.GR (Graphics) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes to integrate pixel neighborhood information to improve the decomposition accuracy and robustness to noise, which could also be relevant to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. The use of a contour prior to prevent crossing image boundaries suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category, as this is a common technique in computer vision and machine learning. Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CV and cs.GR, followed by cs.MM, cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI.
